elements.title: Cora Victoria Diehl (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after Cora Victoria Diehl (pictured) was elected as the first woman to hold office in Oklahoma Territory, county records had to be recovered with dynamite when the incumbent refused to concede?

elements.title: a New Zealand coin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a New Zealand coin was declared evidence of an atheistic government by detractors?

elements.title: Patricia Schultz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Patricia Schultz, the author of 1,000 Places to See Before You Die, would choose Florence for her final trip before dying?

elements.title: children's book illustration (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that children's book illustration techniques include photography?

elements.title: Patrice Gueniffey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that French historian Patrice Gueniffey called the 2023 film Napoleon a "very anti-French and very pro-British" rewrite of history?

elements.title: Oasis of Bukhara (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Oasis of Bukhara used to be a swamp?

elements.title: an American prisoner of war (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that while being held in Stalag Luft I, an American prisoner of war built a violin out of scrap material?

elements.title: garbage-eating goat (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a "welding nun" angered farmers with her garbage-eating goat?
